intro: Mascarenhasia humblotii, commonly known as the Mascarene starwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant is typically herbaceous, with slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, coastal environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
